patterns: Tell me about NRI Group of Institute
Give me information about NRI Group of Institute
History of NRI Group of Institute
When was NRI Group of Institute founded?
Ranking of NRI Group of Institute?
Information on NRI Group of Institute
Ranking of NRI Group of Institute
rank of NRI Group of Institute
significance of NRI Group of Institute
Founder of NRI Group of Institute
responses: NRI Group of Institutions (NGI) was founded by Mr D. Subodh Singh a technocrat and the NRI, in the year 2000. It runs by the Taramathi Education Society formed by NRIs based in the USA and highly qualified technocrats in India. NRI Group of institutions is a leading group of educational institutions of India that is providing professional degrees in engineering, pharmacy, management, law, nursing, physiotherapy and paramedical sciences for 21 years. The institute caters to over 5000+ students studying across 25 acres of high-tech campus. The institute nurture students coming from all walks of society to experience quality and equal education. The college is sensitive to individual, racial, ethnic differences and seeks students from diverse cultural backgrounds. Our institute believes in providing the best of the Indian Education system with a blend of educational techniques of the USA. Apart from providing education, we at NRI believe to develop responsible and sensitive citizens who should always be ready to serve society and the country.
you can call me NRI Institute BOT.
I'm NRI Group of Institute

patterns: How do I go about applying for admission?
What steps do I need to take to be accepted?
What is the procedure for gaining admission?
What is the process for enrolling in the program?
How do I get accepted into the program?
responses:
The admission process at  NRI Institute is as follows: 

1. Fill up the Application Form: The first step is to fill up the online application form. Once the form is filled, the candidate can submit the documents for admission.

2. Submit the Necessary Documents: Once the application form is filled, the candidate needs to submit the necessary documents for admission. The documents required for admission are:

a. Mark sheet of the qualifying examination. 
b. Birth certificate or 10th Marks sheet for age proof. 
c. Migration Certificate (if applicable). 
d. Passport size photographs. 
e. Transfer Certificate.

3. Entrance Test: After the submission of documents, the candidate needs to appear for the entrance test conducted by the university. The entrance test may vary depending on the program the candidate is applying for.

4. Personal Interview: After the entrance test, the candidate will be called for a personal interview. This interview is conducted to assess the candidate’s knowledge, attitude, behavior and communication skills.

5. Final Selection: The final selection of the candidate is based on the performance in the entrance test and personal interview.

6. Payment of the fees of the course.

patterns: What grants, scholarships, and other financial assistance is available

Are there any grants or loans I can use to pay for college
What are my options for paying for college
Are there any financial aid programs I qualify for
Are there any scholarships I can use to pay for college
What scholarships and financial aid options are available
responses:
The University shall offer scholarships in the form of tuition fee waiver to those students who participate and win awards (first prize, second prize, gold medal, silver medal etc...) at different levels as follows:
At District Level -25% of the tuition fees
At State Level- 50% of the tuition fees
At Zonal Level-75% of the tuition fees
At National/International Level- 100% of the Tuition fees
Competitions-
Students will receive complete support from PU in accelerating their goals. Furthermore, the students shall be encouraged and groomed by the best mentors for the state and national level competitions.

responses: The main aim of NRI Institute is to provide an array of job opportunities to students. The University plays an important role  in providing jobs rather than seeking jobs. For this, the University has established various cell/departments to provide support to students in pursuing a career as per their interest. - Career Development Cell, Training & Placement Cell, Research & Development Cell, International Relations Cell, Entrepreneurship Development Cell

responses: An internship is an important part of the academic curriculum because they help one gain practical knowledge and experience required to excel in their respective fields. We at Department of Paramedical & Health Sciences encourage our students to undertake internship under various hospitals and organisations. Students have interned at: • Apollo Hospital, Ahmedabad • Civil Hospital, Ahmedabad • Bankers Heart Hospital, Vadodara • BAPS Hospital, Atladara, Vadodara • BAPS Hospital, Surat • Modi Children Hospital, Vyara, Tapi • Global Hospital, Baroda • Rhythm Hospital, Vadodara • Sterling Hospital, Vadodara • Sunshine Global Hospitals, Vadodara • Vaduwala Eye Hospital, Vadodara • Arogyam Hospital, Ratlam • ASG Eye Hospital, Jamshedpur • General Hospital, Bodeli • Hospital Central De Maputo, Mozambique • Hospital Provincial Da Matola • Hospital Provincial De Gaza • Jamshedpur Eye Hospital, Jamshedpur, Jharkhand • Kadam Eye Hospital, Vadodara • Nobel Medical College, Nepal • Phuentsholing General Hospital, Bhutan • Ramlal Golchha Eye Hospital, Nepal • Sagrmatha Eye Hospital, Nepal • Tilganga Hospital, Nepal • Parul Sevashram Hospital, Vadodara
